intro: Chaetospora tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled sponge spore plant, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, four-angled thallus that gives it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sorocarps, contain spores that are dispersed by wind. The morphology of Chaetospora tetragona reflects adaptations to its specific ecological niche, making it an important component of certain wetland and woodland ecosystems.
